hero.description: Access employment services, benefits, and support programs that help Canadians succeed

ei.title: Employment Insurance
ei.description: Temporary financial assistance while you look for work or upgrade your skills
ei.details: Employment Insurance (EI) provides temporary income support to unemployed Canadians while they look for work or upgrade their skills. Regular benefits are available to individuals who lose their job through no fault of their own and have accumulated enough insurable hours.

oas.title: Old Age Security
oas.description: Monthly payment for seniors 65 years of age and older
oas.details: Old Age Security (OAS) is a monthly payment available to most Canadians 65 years of age or older. You do not need to have worked to receive OAS. The amount you receive depends on how long you have lived in Canada after age 18.

cpp.title: Canada Pension Plan
cpp.description: Contributory retirement pension program for Canadian workers
cpp.details: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) is a contributory, earnings-related social insurance program. It forms one part of Canada's retirement income system. CPP provides basic retirement, disability, and survivor benefits.

jobSearch.title: Job Search
jobSearch.description: Find employment opportunities across Canada with Job Bank
jobSearch.details: Job Bank is Canada's national employment service. Search thousands of jobs, explore labour market trends, and access career planning tools to help you find your next opportunity.

benefitsFinder.title: Benefits Finder
benefitsFinder.description: Discover what government benefits and services you may be eligible for
benefitsFinder.details: Answer a few simple questions to get a personalized list of federal, provincial and territorial benefits and services you may be eligible to receive.
